transcript: â€‰ NEW YORK, July 16, 2025Â BUSINESS WIREÂ The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today that Aude Gandon has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. "Aude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age," said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. "Her deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty." As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. "I am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," said Aude Gandon. "As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels." Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements Statements in this Â  may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such statements include those in the various quotations. Although the Company believes that its expectations are based on reasonable assumptions within the bounds of its knowledge of its business and operations, actual results may differ materially from the Company's expectations. Factors that could cause actual results to differ from expectations include the ability to successfully implement its strategy, including the Company's profit recovery and growth plan; successfully transition its leadership; and those other factors described in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K. The Company assumes no responsibility to update forward-looking statements made herein or otherwise. About The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products, and is a steward of luxury and prestige brands globally. The Company's products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: EstÃ©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MÂ·AÂ·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums FrÃ©dÃ©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty. View the full release here: Aude Gandon, Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. â€œAude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age,â€ said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. â€œHer deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty." As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. â€œI am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," said Aude Gandon. " As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. transcript: â€‰ Subjects: Photo/Multimedia, Personnel The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today that Aude Gandon has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. "Aude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age," said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. "Her deep expertise across all facets of marketing?from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analytics?will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty." As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. "I am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," said Aude Gandon. "As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels." Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. Such statements include those in the various quotations. Although the Company believes that its expectations are based on reasonable assumptions within the bounds of its knowledge of its business and operations, actual results may differ materially from the Company's expectations. Factors that could cause actual results to differ from expectations include the ability to successfully implement its strategy, including the Company's profit recovery and growth plan; successfully transition its leadership; and those other factors described in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K. The Company assumes no responsibility to update forward-looking statements made herein or otherwise. The Company's products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: EstÃ©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MÂ·AÂ·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums FrÃ©dÃ©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty. reasoning: This is a press release about EstÃ©e Lauder Companies' new Chief Digital and Marketing Officer, which only briefly mentions Le Labo as one of many brands in the company's portfolio. The content does not provide any specific information about Le Labo fragrances or meaningful brand-related insights.

transcript: â€‰ NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today thatÂ Aude GandonÂ has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. â€œAude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age,â€ saidÂ StÃ©phane de La Faverie. â€œHer deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty." As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. â€œI am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," saidÂ Aude Gandon.Â " As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements Statements in this press release may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such statements include those in the various quotations. Although the Company believes that its expectations are based on reasonable assumptions within the bounds of its knowledge of its business and operations, actual results may differ materially from the Company's expectations. Factors that could cause actual results to differ from expectations include the ability to successfully implement its strategy, including the Company's profit recovery and growth plan; successfully transition its leadership; and those other factors described in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K. The Company assumes no responsibility to update forward-looking statements made herein or otherwise. About The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products, and is a steward of luxury and prestige brands globally. The Company's products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: EstÃ©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MÂ·AÂ·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums FrÃ©dÃ©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty. cleaned_transcript: NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today that Aude Gandon has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. â€œAude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age,â€ said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. â€œHer deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty." As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. â€œI am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," said Aude Gandon. " As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. Such statements include those in the various quotations. Factors that could cause actual results to differ from expectations include the ability to successfully implement its strategy, including the Company's profit recovery and growth plan; successfully transition its leadership; and those other factors described in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K. The Company assumes no responsibility to update forward-looking statements made herein or otherwise. The Company's products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: EstÃ©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MÂ·AÂ·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums FrÃ©dÃ©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty. transcript: â€‰ NEW YORK--(ë‰´ìŠ¤ì™€ì´ì–´)--The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today that Aude Gandon has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. â€œAude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age,â€ said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. â€œHer deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty.â€ As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&> Beauty, and LVMH. â€œI am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation,â€œ said Aude Gandon. â€ As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements Statements in this press release may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such statements include those in the various quotations. Although the Company believes that its expectations are based on reasonable assumptions within the bounds of its knowledge of its business and operations, actual results may differ materially from the Company's expectations. Factors that could cause actual results to differ from expectations include the ability to successfully implement its strategy, including the Company's profit recovery and growth plan; successfully transition its leadership; and those other factors described in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K. The Company assumes no responsibility to update forward-looking statements made herein or otherwise. About The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products, and is a steward of luxury and prestige brands globally. The Company's products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: EstÃ©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MÂ·AÂ·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums FrÃ©dÃ©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. transcript: â€‰ Our fourth retrograde transit for July starts on Friday 18, when Mercury Retrograde is back. It joins Pluto, Saturn and Neptune for a backwards spin , and cementing July 2025 as an emotionally challenging month. This Mercury Retrograde â€“ which falls in Leo â€“ is the second Mercury Retrograde of the year, and unfortunately not the last. It runs from 18 July to 11 August and this is a transit that will hit us hardest in our personal relationships, while also challenging our own sense of self. Of course, be mindful of the usual travel delays and process disruptions too. Here's everything you need to know about the July and August Mercury Retrograde and how it will affect you. What happens during Mercury Retrograde? From a technical perspective, Mercury Retrograde is a period of time where the planet Mercury appears to move backwards in the sky. This time-frame typically lasts for about three weeks and happens three to four times a year. Now, of course, Mercury is not actually moving backwards, but owning to its angle to the Earth at that time, this is what it looks and feels like. There is also something called a Mercury Retrograde pre-shadow period, which is the period where Mercury's travel begins to slowdown before eventually heading backwards. Astrologically speaking, Mercury Retrograde is considered a karmic and short-term whirlwind. It is a short and sharp burst that blows in, disrupting everything from travel plans to text messages, before leaving as quick as it came. Our messenger, Mercury is the planet of transit and communications. It rules the movement of anything transiting from A to B. It also rules over ideas, intellect and the mind. As such, when Mercury is in a retrograde transit, these are the areas of life that can become challenged. Think missed trains, misunderstood conversations, flight cancellations and the inability to communicate your own thoughts and feelings. The typical advice for all Mercury retrogrades is to not put gossip in writing and to avoid signing binding contracts at this time. Leo is opens up our hearts â€“ but be wary of the selfishness of others As this Mercury Retrograde comes in Leo for the full duration, this transit will be guided by the proud and dramatic energy of this bubbly Fire sign. Leo knows how to bring the drama and tell a great story. If you know a Leo, they'll be one of the most fun people at every party, its what we love about this vibrant sign. But it does have its problems; this sign is notoriously self-centred and can be inconsiderate of others. We can go as far as saying, dramatic, ego-centric and wholly self-serving at its absolute worst. Leo energy â€“ especially when it afflicts our planet of ideas and communication â€“ can make us all more selfish and deeply concerned with our own affairs. Do not be surprised if you notice that in your personal relationships and other people around you have very little care for anything but their own self. This moment can make the people around us particularly concerned with their own status and public perception, and with no consideration for how their actions affect the people. It's a bitter pill to swallow for those among us who try to genuinely support and uplift others. So what to do if you've been subject to these situations? Do not let this rock your sense of self. It is easy â€“ especially during a Mercury Retrograde â€“ to feel as though your identity has been shattered. But you have to remember that other people's actions are not a reflection of you and who you are. In terms of how you respond, now is not the time to start arguments. Be very mindful about you say and how you say it. Even a small miscommunication has the potential to blow up. Keep to yourself and protect your peace. On the flip side, if you do notice that you've been a little less considerate of late, just know that a genuine â€œsorryâ€ always goes a long way. If you're in the midst of planning an event or working on a new project at work, know that this Mercury Retrograde can make us all very resistant to embracing the ideas of others. Try to having meetings and catch ups in-person to avoid any potential mix ups. You will need to be flexible enough to accomodate any resistance, that is, if you want to emerge unscathed. Try to take ego out of the equation at work. Leo loves the ideas of our work lives appearing much more glamorous than they are. But if this is inhibiting your ability to meaningfully contribute, you won't reap rewards in the long run. Remember, the cream always rises to the top. Finally, if you're travelling, do remember to give yourself extra time to get to the airport! Image: Navi Â onÂ  Unsplash SHOP YOUR SIGN CASETiFY Gemini Phone Case SHOP...

transcript: â€‰ NEW YORK -Â  (BUSINESS WIRE)--The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today that Aude Gandon has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. â€œAude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age,â€ said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. â€œHer deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty. " As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. â€œI am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," said Aude Gandon. "As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. Cautionary Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements Statements in this press release may constitute forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Such statements include those in the various quotations. Although the Company believes that its expectations are based on reasonable assumptions within the bounds of its knowledge of its business and operations, actual results may differ materially from the Company's expectations. Factors that could cause actual results to differ from expectations include the ability to successfully implement its strategy, including the Company's profit recovery and growth plan; successfully transition its leadership; and those other factors described in the Company's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including its most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K. The Company assumes no responsibility to update forward-looking statements made herein or otherwise. About The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers, marketers, and sellers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products, and is a steward of luxury and prestige brands globally. The Company's products are sold in approximately 150 countries and territories under brand names including: EstÃ©e Lauder, Aramis, Clinique, Lab Series, Origins, MÂ·AÂ·C, La Mer, Bobbi Brown Cosmetics, Aveda, Jo Malone London, Bumble and bumble, Darphin Paris, TOM FORD, Smashbox, AERIN Beauty, Le Labo, Editions de Parfums FrÃ©dÃ©ric Malle, GLAMGLOW, KILIAN PARIS, Too Faced, Dr.Jart+, the DECIEM family of brands, including The Ordinary and NIOD, and BALMAIN Beauty. transcript: â€‰ NEW YORK -Â  (BUSINESS WIRE)--The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies Inc. (NYSE: EL) announced today that Aude Gandon has been appointed Chief Digital & Marketing Officer (CDMO), effective August 1, 2025. Ms. Gandon will report directly to StÃ©phane de La Faverie, President and Chief Executive Officer, and will join the company's Executive Team. In this newly created role, Ms. Gandon will lead the transformation of the company's digital, marketing and media ecosystem, shaping end-to-end strategies across its powerful brand portfolio, and will oversee global digital commerce. Her appointment reflects the company's commitment to evolving its consumer-centric approach and strengthening marketing as a commercial growth engine. â€œAude is an exceptional and accomplished global marketing leader with extensive experience transforming major consumer-facing businesses in the digital age,â€ said StÃ©phane de La Faverie. â€œHer deep expertise across all facets of marketingâ€”from brand strategy and creative development to digital transformation and data analyticsâ€”will be instrumental as we continue to build stronger consumer connections. Her global perspective and proven track record of leading large-scale marketing, digital and media transformations make her the ideal leader for this critical role as we shape the future of prestige beauty. " As CDMO, Ms. Gandon will lead the company's precision marketing, creative operations, consumer and category insights, regional store design and visual merchandising, omnichannel media strategy, and global consumer care; she will also oversee global digital commerce and partner closely with regional leadership to accelerate Online performance. This broad remit positions Ms. Gandon to elevate the consumer journey at every touchpoint to drive and amplify brand equity through creativity, precision and performance. Ms. Gandon brings a unique blend of visionary leadership, digital expertise and creative acumen. She joins The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies from NestlÃ©, where she most recently served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and led the company's digital transformation across 188 markets and more than 2,000 brands. She implemented new operating models, launched many global content studios, and developed strategic partnerships with major tech platforms, including Google, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix. Prior to NestlÃ©, Ms. Gandon held leadership roles at Google, including Global Managing Director for Platform & Ecosystems, where she led integrated brand and creative strategies across five continents. Her earlier career includes senior roles in global advertising agencies such as Publicis Worldwide, McCann, and Leo Burnett, working with world-class beauty and luxury clients including L'OrÃ©al, P&G Beauty, and LVMH. â€œI am thrilled to join The EstÃ©e Lauder Companies, a company with an unparalleled portfolio of powerful brands and a strong heritage of innovation," said Aude Gandon. "As consumer behaviors continue to evolve, the opportunity to lead the digital and marketing transformation for a premier prestige beauty company is incredibly exciting. I look forward to partnering with the talented teams there to enhance our digital capabilities, deepen consumer connections, and drive growth across brands and channels.â€ Ms. Gandon has previously served on the Board of Directors for CAPSUM, an innovative developer of skin care and makeup formulas, and is currently a board member of the World Federation of Advertisers, where she represents Europe and is chair of the Global CMO Committee. She also serves on the Amazon Ad Council and Meta Client Council. transcript: â€‰ Perfume is more than just a fragranceâ€”it's Login BolagilaÂ a reflection of who we are. The scent we choose says something personal and intimate. It lingers in memory, marks special moments, and even builds our identity. This is why perfume continues to play such a powerful role in people's everyday lives. The Emotional Connection to Fragrance Fragrance triggers emotion like few other things can. A single scent can transport someone back to childhood, a romantic evening, or a joyful celebration. This deep emotional tie makes perfume more than fashionâ€”it becomes part of life's soundtrack, leaving invisible traces of memories behind wherever we go. The Enduring Power of Signature Scents Many people become known for their signature scent. Friends and loved ones begin to associate them with a particular fragrance. This habit creates continuity, giving a sense of identity that's comforting and recognizable. Signature scents often become extensions of the wearer, chosen carefully to represent mood, personality, and style. Designer Perfumes That Dominate Shelves Major designers continue to shape the fragrance world. Scents like Chanel's Coco Mademoiselle, Dior's J'adore, and Yves Saint Laurent's Mon Paris remain favorites. These perfumes combine art and luxury, offering something timeless. Their popularity proves how carefully crafted scents can transcend time and speak to multiple generations of wearers. Why Celebrity Perfumes Still Sell Celebrity perfumes bring fame and fragrance together. Pop stars and actors create scents that reflect their image and connect with fans. Ariana Grande, Rihanna, and Sarah Jessica Parker have all released successful perfumes. These products allow people to feel closer to someone they admire while also discovering scents that suit them. Scent and Season: Finding the Right Fit Different seasons call for different fragrances. Fresh, airy florals and citrus blends are perfect for spring and summer, offering lightness and energy. Autumn and winter invite deeper, spicier notes like amber, musk, and vanilla. Matching a perfume to the weather helps amplify its beauty and wearability throughout the year. The Quiet Rise of Niche Fragrances Niche perfume houses offer a more artistic approach. With small batches and unique ingredients, brands like Le Labo and Byredo appeal to those seeking individuality. These perfumes don't follow mainstream trends, which makes them feel special. They speak to people who want to wear something no one else has discovered. Bolagila and the Modern Perfume Landscape Among the growing crowd of new perfume houses, Bolagila stands out for its clean lines and elegant scents. With a focus on simplicity, balance, and refinement, Bolagila caters to those who appreciate modern luxury without excessive complexity. The brand captures a contemporary vision of elegance through its thoughtful fragrance compositions. Affordable Fragrances With Lasting Impressions Perfume doesn't have to be expensive to be beautiful. Many affordable brands offer high-quality scents at accessible prices. These options give everyone the chance to enjoy fragrance as part of daily life. Great scent experiences are available at every price point, making perfume an inclusive and joyful part of self-care. Perfume's Lasting Role in Everyday Life Perfume will always have a place in human expression. It influences mood, enhances style, and creates lasting impressions. Whether you wear a classic designer fragrance or explore new brands like Bolagila, the right scent becomes part of your personal storyâ€”a quiet, invisible companion that speaks without saying a word.
